item.title: Tomasz Tunguz’s Theory Ventures bets $12M on Initia, the ‘iOS for web3’
item.dc:creator: Rita Liao
item.description:
The promise of blockchain to change the world hasn’t materialized. For the most part, the technology has instead enabled people to speculate on a new asset class. A big hurdle to realizing blockchain’s full potential, web3 proponents argue, is that decentralized services are incredibly hard to build. Tomasz Tunguz, best known for his popular startup […]

item.title: Mozilla hit with privacy complaint in EU over Firefox tracking tech
item.dc:creator: Natasha Lomas
item.description:
Mozilla, the non-profit that develops the Firefox web browser, has been hit with a complaint by European Union privacy rights group noyb, which accuses it of violating the bloc’s General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) by tracking Firefox users by default without their permission. It’s unusual to see a privacy complaint targeting Mozilla, an organization which […]

item.title: Radian Aerospace completes ground tests of prototype space plane
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description:
Radian Aerospace has moved one step closer to achieving the “holy grail” of spaceflight: a reusable space plane that can take-off from an airfield and land on a runway like a conventional airplane. The startup just announced completion of a series of ground tests in Abu Dhabi earlier this summer.  The tests were completed with […]

item.title: WhatFix raises a whopping $125M for its in-app user guides
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Digital transformation — upgrading a company’s legacy apps and processes with new tech — has long been a buzzy and lucrative business. But the pandemic supercharged the market. Covid pandemic lockdowns and the widespread move to work-from-home spurred brands relying on old technology to modernize their organizations. item.title: Google’s revised ad targeting plan triggers fresh competition concerns in UK
item.dc:creator: Natasha Lomas
item.description:
What is going on with Google’s long-touted migration to an alternative adtech stack (aka its Privacy Sandbox proposal)? What indeed. The entire multi-year endeavour to reshape the commercial web looks dangerously close to being killed off after the latest intervention by the U.K.’s antitrust regulator, the Competition and Markets Authority (CMA). item.title: Hone Capital, a Silicon Valley firm, is being probed by the FBI
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description:
According to the FT, the FBI is now poking around nine-year-old Hone Capital, a Palo Alto, Ca.-based venture firm funded by a Chinese private equity firm, to determine whether some of its capital came from the Chinese government — and if it shared sensitive startup data with Beijing. Originally launched with $115 million from China’s […]

item.title: Salesforce snatches up Zoomin, a tool for organizing company knowledge
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Salesforce is on a buying spree. After snatching up data management firm Own earlier in the month, Salesforce today announced its plans to buy Zoomin, an enterprise knowledge platform. Zoomin — which we’ve covered a handful of times before — unifies a company’s docs, like product user guides and tutorials, in one portal. The terms […]

item.title: ChatGPT: Everything you need to know about the AI-powered chatbot
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers, Cody Corrall, Alyssa Stringer
item.description:
ChatGPT, OpenAI’s text-generating AI chatbot, has taken the world by storm since its launch in November 2022. What started as a tool to hyper-charge productivity through writing essays and code with short text prompts has evolved into a behemoth used by more than 92% of Fortune 500 companies. item.title: Caroline Ellison sentenced to two years in prison for FTX fraud
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description:
Caroline Ellison, the former CEO of FTX affiliate Alameda Research, was sentenced to two years in prison on Tuesday. Ellison pled guilty to conspiring with FTX’s Sam Bankman-Fried to steal $8 billion worth of customers’ funds, but she was an exceedingly cooperative witness, helping law enforcement to investigate the massive fraud scheme.
